title: Track processed input files to prevent duplicate post generation
description:
Add tracking mechanism to remember which input files have been processed and skip them on subsequent runs. Include a --force flag to explicitly reprocess all files. This prevents duplicate posts from being generated when running 't2p work' multiple times on the same input files.

Implementation details:
- Track processed files (filename + timestamp or hash) in a state file (.t2p-state.json or similar)
- On 't2p work', check state file and skip already-processed files
- Add '--force' flag to bypass tracking and reprocess all files
- Display clear messaging about skipped vs processed files
- Consider tracking file modification time to detect changes

Implement t2p analyze x command to generate style guide from X posts
description:
Add 't2p analyze x' command that uses X API v2 to fetch user's posts and generate a style guide based on their writing patterns.

RESEARCH FINDINGS (2025):
- X API v2 Free tier provides 100 reads/month - sufficient for style analysis
- Requires OAuth 2.0 authentication (User Context)
- Can fetch up to 100 recent tweets via User Post Timeline endpoint
- Rate limit: 180 requests per 15 minutes (per user)

IMPLEMENTATION PLAN:
Phase 1: Free tier OAuth implementation
- Use OAuth 2.0 with PKCE for user authentication
- Fetch user's own tweets via User Post Timeline endpoint
- Analyze ~100 recent tweets with Ollama
- Generate and save style guide to prompts/style.md

TECHNICAL DETAILS:
- Endpoint: GET /2/users/:id/tweets
- Auth: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code with PKCE
- Rate limits: 100 reads/month (free tier)
- Data: Can retrieve 100 tweets per request with pagination

LIMITATIONS:
- User needs X developer account (free to register)
- 100 reads/month = can analyze 1 user per month on free tier
- Upgrade to Basic ($200/month) for 10,000 reads if needed

Tech debt: Extract duplicate time formatting to shared utility
description:
Multiple files implement similar time formatting logic:
- src/commands/posts.ts:21-23
- src/commands/reply.ts:86-88  
- src/commands/x-status.ts:14-15

All use variations of Math.floor(diffMs / 60000) for time calculations.

- Support minutes, hours, days output
- Replace duplicated code across files

title: Tech debt: Create proper TypeScript interfaces for X API responses
description:
Multiple 'as any' type assertions in x-api.ts and stats.ts when accessing Twitter API response fields:
- x-api.ts:154,161,163,245,283,316,330
- stats.ts:309,343-345

These casts indicate missing type definitions for the twitter-api-v2 library responses.

Recommendation:
- Create src/types/x-api-responses.ts with proper interfaces
- Define PublicMetrics, OrganicMetrics, NonPublicMetrics interfaces
- Replace 'as any' with proper typed access

title: Tech debt: Extract magic numbers to named constants
description:
Multiple hardcoded numeric values scattered throughout the codebase:
- 5_000_000 (follower goal) in stats.ts:249 and reply.ts:358
- Time constants (24*60*60*1000) repeated many times
- MIN_FOLLOWERS = 10000 in reply.ts:426
- Cache durations (60*60*1000) in multiple files
- Character thresholds (500, 1500) in content-analyzer.ts:75-79

Recommendation:
- Create src/constants.ts with named constants
- Group by domain: TIME_MS, GOALS, FILTERS, THRESHOLDS
- Replace magic numbers across codebase

title: Tech debt: Refactor long functions in work.ts and reply.ts
description:
Several functions exceed 200+ lines, making them hard to maintain and test:
- workCommand() in work.ts: 392 lines (lines 175-566)
- replyCommand() in reply.ts: 248 lines (lines 283-530)
- statsCommand() in stats.ts: 225 lines (lines 77-301)

Recommendation:
- Extract logical blocks into smaller named functions
- Separate concerns: data fetching, processing, display
- Improve testability by breaking up monolithic functions

title: Tech debt: Create shared JSON extraction utility
description:
JSON extraction from LLM responses is duplicated:
- src/services/content-analyzer.ts:40-68 uses regex /\{[\s\S]*?\}/
- src/utils/banger-eval.ts:61-94 uses similar pattern with fallbacks
- src/commands/work.ts:39-77 uses /\n---\n/ to split posts

Recommendation:
- Create src/utils/json-parser.ts with extractJSON() function
- Handle common edge cases: markdown code blocks, multiple objects
- Add robust error handling and fallback logic

title: Tech debt: Add logging to silent error catches
description:
Several catch blocks silently return null/false without any logging:
- src/services/ollama.ts:26-28, 35-37
- src/services/content-analyzer.ts:34-37, 65-67
- src/utils/banger-eval.ts:109-111
- src/services/x-api.ts:257-260, 294-296

This makes debugging difficult when errors occur.

Recommendation:
- Add debug-level logging to catch blocks
- Log error context for troubleshooting
- Consider returning error objects instead of null for better error propagation

title: Performance: Optimize Date object creation in stats.ts filtering loops
description:
Performance issue: Creating new Date objects for every element in array filter operations (src/commands/stats.ts:204-206, 403, 417, 430). With 100+ tweets, this creates 300+ unnecessary Date instantiations.

Affected code:
- last24h/last7d/last30d filters each create new Date per item
- getDailyPostCounts, getDailyImpressions, getHourlyEngagement all parse dates in loops

Recommendation:
- Parse dates once before the loops
- Pre-compute timestamps for comparison
- Cache parsed dates in a Map keyed by tweet ID

title: Performance: Batch file writes in review.ts instead of per-item writes
description:
Performance issue: review.ts:180 writes the entire posts file for each individual post status update. For 100 posts reviewed, this writes 100 files.

Recommendation:
- Collect all changes during the review session
- Write once at the end of the review loop
- This will significantly improve I/O performance for batch reviews

title: Add deep mining feature to generate more posts from specific input files
description:
Allow users to extract additional post ideas from a specific input file that has already been processed. Enable 'deeper mining' of valuable transcripts to get more post variations and angles.

Implementation options:
- Add '--file <path>' and '--more <n>' flags to 't2p work' command
  Example: t2p work --file input/meeting.txt --more 5
- Or create new command: t2p mine <file> [--count <n>]
- Generate posts with different angles/perspectives from the same content
- Maybe add '--focus <topic>' to guide the mining toward specific themes
- Consider tracking total posts generated per file in state
- Useful for high-value transcripts with lots of insights

Use cases:
- User processes all files, then realizes one meeting had great content
- Want 10 more post ideas from that specific file
- Don't want to reprocess all files, just deep-dive on one

title: Security: Validate editor command in reply.ts to prevent command injection
description:
CRITICAL SECURITY ISSUE: The reply command uses process.env.VISUAL/EDITOR directly in spawnSync without validation (src/commands/reply.ts:182-191). An attacker who can set environment variables could inject arbitrary commands.

Recommendation:
- Validate editor against a whitelist of known safe editors (vim, vi, nano, code, etc.)
- Or parse the command to detect shell metacharacters
- Sanitize the editor path before passing to spawnSync

title: Security: Use safe temporary file creation in reply.ts
description:
MEDIUM SECURITY ISSUE: Temporary file creation in reply.ts:173,179 uses predictable naming with Date.now(). This creates a TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-Time-Of-Use) vulnerability.

Recommendation:
- Use Node's built-in fs.mkdtemp() for safe temp file creation
- Or use the 'tmp' library for secure temporary file handling

title: When posts are generated, evaluate them on a 'banger' scale - score 1-99 based on prediction
description:
Add a scoring system to evaluate generated posts on their potential to be 'bangers' (viral/highly engaging posts).

Implementation:
1. Research what makes X/Twitter posts 'bangers' (high engagement, virality factors)
2. Create a new prompt template (prompts/banger-eval.md) based on research
3. Add post evaluation step after generation in work.ts
4. Score each post 1-99 on banger potential
5. Store score in post metadata

Research topics:
- Viral tweet characteristics
- Hook effectiveness
- Emotional triggers
- Timing and relevance factors
- Engagement patterns
- What makes posts shareable

Output format:
- Add 'bangerScore' field to Post type
- Store in posts.jsonl metadata
- Optional: Sort/filter posts by score

title: Refactor init.ts so that the embedded prompts are pulled from individual .md files in the source code
description:
Currently init.ts has large string constants (STYLE_TEMPLATE, WORK_TEMPLATE, SYSTEM_TEMPLATE, ANALYSIS_TEMPLATE) embedded in the code. Refactor to load these from individual .md files in the source code (e.g., src/templates/style.md).

Benefits:
- Easier to maintain and edit templates
- Better separation of content from code
- Cleaner TypeScript files
- Templates can be reviewed/edited without reading TS code

Implementation:
- Create src/templates/ directory
- Move each template constant to a .md file
- Update init.ts to read from these files using readFileSync
- Ensure templates are included in npm package distribution
